page.lettertext:
fol.145v
To my L. T
re
r May 16 1591.
fol.145r
Belgia
1591 16 May To my L Trea
s
Belgia: 1591: May.
May it please yo
r
good L. Being instantly requested by
those that were the Deputies in
e last negotiation of
e
states
w
th
her
Ma
ty
,
I am in theyr behalf to crave
e benefit
of yo
r
favour, to
e effect of that letter, w
ch
is written by
the states to
e
LL of
e councell
. It is
e sute of
Herman Roodenburg
of
Amsterdam,
who being an assistant
in
England
to
e foresaid Deputies was arrested in
London
by one
Gerard
of
Malines
upon p
r
tence of certain dett
; The cowrse that
hath bin held in po
r
sute of his cause is declared at good
length in theyr publick letter, & wilbe signifed more at large
by theyr agent
M
r
Caron
. Although I let th
e
und
r
stand
t
that
e states petition to
e LL will
cure as much favour as
e equity of
eir cause doth any waie require, yet w
th
out my letter
to yo
r
L. they thinke theyr deling insufficient. For w
ch
yo
r
L.
will bee pleased to par don my bold intercession & to give mee leave
to entreat for some convenient expedition in
e finall end
ing
of
e sute.
Wh
r
in if the party shalbee pleasured, I shalbee thought by
e
Deputies, to have written my l
re
s as they have earnestly
desired, very effectually
un
to you.
of
e states proceding
in
e
i
ploim
e
t of their forces I have signified
two daies past. It is thought that by this
they
are
mette all together, so
at nowe we doe
expect the effectes of their meeting: wherof yo
r
L. shall have knowledge w
t
e spedeiest
opportis
opportunitie.
Fr
o
e Hage. May 16 1591.
